content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans. I understand that I'm in READ-ONLY mode and cannot modify, create, or delete any files.

Let me start by getting familiar with the project structure:

<bash>
ls -la /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/packages/desktop/src-tauri
</bash>

<bash>
find /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent -type f -name "*.toml" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "package.json" | head -20
</bash>

<bash>
cat /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/package.json 2>/dev/null || cat /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/packages/desktop/package.json
</bash>

I'm warmed up and ready to explore the codebase. I can see this is a Tauri-based desktop application with a Go backend. The recent commits indicate work on auto-updates, social sharing metadata, and OG tags.

What would you like me to help you design or explore?
